raw_text: For instance, instead of representing the polarity of a term using a binary value, Mullen and Collier (2004) use Turney? s (2002) method to assign a real value to represent term polarity and introduce a variety of numerical features that are aggregate measures of the polarity values of terms selected from the document under consideration
clean_text: For instance, instead of representing the polarity of a term using a binary value, Mullen and Collier (2004) use Turney's (2002) method to assign a real value to represent term polarity and introduce a variety of numerical features that are aggregate measures of the polarity values of terms selected from the document under consideration.

raw_text: They re ported a statistically significant improvement over a Naive Bayes baseline using the whole text but only slight increase compared to using a SVM classifier on the entire document. Mullen and Collier (2004) used SVMs and expanded the feature set for representing documents with favor ability measures from a variety of diverse sources
clean_text: Mullen and Collier (2004) used SVMs and expanded the feature set for representing documents with favor ability measures from a variety of diverse sources.

raw_text: SVM with unigrams& amp; binary weights (Pang et al, 2002), reported at (Pang and Lee, 2004) 87.15% Hybrid SVM with Turney/Osgood Lemmas (Mullen and Collier, 2004) 86% SVM with min-cuts (Pang and Lee, 2004) 87.2% SVM with appraisal groups 90.2% (Whitelaw et al, 2005) SVM with log like hood ratio feature selection (Aue and Gamon, 2005) 90.45% SVM with annotator rationales 92.2% (Zaidan et al, 2007) LDA with filtered lexicon ,subjectivity detection (Lin and He, 2009) 84.6% The approach is straightforward, intuitive, computationally efficient ,doesn? t require additional human effort and takes into consideration standardized and tested notions from IR

raw_text: Despite the large amount of recent work on sentiment analysis and opinion mining, much of it has focused on supervised methods (e.g., Pang et al (2002), Kim and Hovy (2004), Mullen and Collier (2004))

raw_text: Another method is to use proximal information of the query and the word, using syntactic structure such as dependency relations of words that provide the graphical representation of the text (Mullen and Collier, 2004)

raw_text: Mullen and Collier (2004) manually annotated named entities in their dataset (i.e. title of the record and name of the artist for music record reviews), and utilized presence and position features in their ML approach
